question:
A company's website uses an Amazon EC2 instance store for its catalog of items. The company wants to make sure that the catalog is highly available and that the catalog is stored in a durable location.
What should a solutions architect do to meet these requirements?

options.A: Replicate the S3 bucket that contains the website to all AWS Regions. Add Route 53 geolocation routing entries.
options.B: Provision accelerators in AWS Global Accelerator. Associate the supplied IP addresses with the S3 bucket. Edit the Route 53 entries to point to the IP addresses of the accelerators.
options.C: Add an Amazon CloudFront distribution in front of the S3 bucket. Edit the Route 53 entries to point to the CloudFront distribution.
options.D: Enable S3 Transfer Acceleration on the bucket. Edit the Route 53 entries to point to the new endpoint.

explanation: CloudFront is the most cost-effective solution for reducing latency for static website content. It caches content at edge locations globally and integrates seamlessly with S3.
